meanings.sent1: The idolater prayed to the statue every day.
meanings.sent2: In ancient times, idolaters believed in many gods.
meanings.sent3: The idolater thought the statue could hear their wishes.
meanings.sent4: She was an idolater of wealth, always chasing after money.
meanings.sent5: The idolater's devotion to the idol was unwavering.

meanings.definition: One who blindly or excessively admires someone or something.
meanings.sent1: As an idolater of celebrities, she collected every magazine they were in.
meanings.sent2: The young girl was an idolater of her favorite singer, hanging posters all over her room.
meanings.sent3: The idolater thought the actor could do no wrong, even in the silliest roles.
meanings.sent4: He was an idolater of nature, finding beauty in every leaf and flower.
meanings.sent5: The idolater's admiration for the artist knew no bounds.
